reason.raw: Declining this pull request in order to triage old pull requests.
reason.html: Declining this pull request in order to triage old pull requests.

description.raw:
This adds integration of a Siconos-based Physics engine to Gazebo.  Note that it currently depends on the git 'master' branch of Siconos.  Once Siconos 4.1.0 is released, I will work on stable and 'master' versions.  Siconos is not yet available through Debian/Ubuntu, however a daily PPA is [available](https://code.launchpad.net/~siconos/+archive/ubuntu/siconos-daily) and a stable Debian package is currently in development.

This currently only supports a couple of primitives and joint types, and parameters are hard-coded.  Very much work in progress.  It may be better to leave it in a branch for now, but I make this PR to make the work public.

Siconos is a general modeling and simulation library for non-smooth dynamical systems, of which mechanical rigid body systems are a subset.  More information on Siconos can be found at http://siconos.gforge.inria.fr/

* Add physics engine "siconos", with a skeleton PhysicsEngine instance.

    No joints implemented, parameters are hard-coded, many TODO items, but
    basic bouncing ball works.

* Add SiconosBoxShape.

* Add rudimentary "add force" mechanism to SiconosLink.

* Add a bit of friction to the default NSLaw.

* Vector conversions for SiconosVector and ignition.

* Use a SiconosContactor for each shape.

* Enable the GeneralMechanical solver.

* Implement SiconosHingeJoint.

* Implement SiconosSliderJoint.

* Change gazebo8_siconos_integration to siconos_integration
description.html:
This adds integration of a Siconos-based Physics engine to Gazebo. Note that it currently depends on the git 'master' branch of Siconos. Once Siconos 4.1.0 is released, I will work on stable and 'master' versions. Siconos is not yet available through Debian/Ubuntu, however a daily PPA is available and a stable Debian package is currently in development.

This currently only supports a couple of primitives and joint types, and parameters are hard-coded. Very much work in progress. It may be better to leave it in a branch for now, but I make this PR to make the work public.

Siconos is a general modeling and simulation library for non-smooth dynamical systems, of which mechanical rigid body systems are a subset. More information on Siconos can be found at http://siconos.gforge.inria.fr/

  • Add physics engine "siconos", with a skeleton PhysicsEngine instance.

    No joints implemented, parameters are hard-coded, many TODO items, but basic bouncing ball works.

  • Add SiconosBoxShape.

  • Add rudimentary "add force" mechanism to SiconosLink.

  • Add a bit of friction to the default NSLaw.

  • Vector conversions for SiconosVector and ignition.

  • Use a SiconosContactor for each shape.

  • Enable the GeneralMechanical solver.

  • Implement SiconosHingeJoint.

  • Implement SiconosSliderJoint.

  • Change gazebo8_siconos_integration to siconos_integration
